726210f-a.title: Queens: Bridge Plaza North - Hunter Street
726210f-a.text:
Bridge Plaza North, at Hunter Street, looking north from
underneath the 'El' pillars. The Corn Exchange Bank, the Long
Island City Savings Bank, and the First Mortgage Guarantee
Company are located on the Bridge Plaza, whereas the Title
Guarantee and Trust Company office and the Bshk of the Manhattan
Company Suilding are on 4lst Avenue.
Ewing Galloway  About 1927
NO REPRODUUCTIONS
726210f-a.folder: Bridge Plaza North & Hunter Street, Queens, NY

726209f-a.title: Queens: Bridge Plaza North - Hunter Street
726209f-a.text:
Bridge Plaza, west from Hunter Street, toward the Queensboro
Vridge, shcwing this lovely area hefore the subway ''El'' recched
here and the street car was the only means of public conveyance.
The building with the clock tower is the Brewster Building, still
standtng at this writing (1941) and first appearing in a 1909 atlas.
The white building preceding it marks the site on which was later
erected tbe nine-story building of the New York and Queens Llectric
Light and Power Company. The writer of these lines is unable to
determine whether this four-story structure is the earlier building
of the electric company.
Cn the left, above the entrance to the second frame hoase is the
inscriptions'Which will you have--The wagges of sin is death, but the
Eift of God is aternal liTe through Jesas Christ our Lord.'' The three-
story building preceding the wooied area is the local office of the
Vestern Union Telegraph and Cable Company.
Trbrock Collection  Aboub 1910
HAY PE REPRODUCED
